definition: to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)

sentences.chinese: 那场比赛的输赢事先已讲定。

sentences.english: Each variety had a different structure of rewards for winning, losing, or drawing.
sentences.chinese: 每一个变体各有不同的输赢或平局的奖励结构。

sentences.english: He and his friends enjoy playing cards for low stakes.
sentences.chinese: 他和他的朋友喜欢来小笔输赢的牌戏。

sentences.english: What you achieved goes way beyond the win-loss column.
sentences.chinese: 你们今天所做到的远比输赢更重要。

sentences.english: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
sentences.chinese: 昨天的失误无法弥补，但明天的输赢可以去拼。

sentences.english: My main concern Love - is with the W 's and L's .
sentences.chinese: 我关注的是一场比赛的输赢。

sentences.english: Through thick or thin. Through wins and loses. Through championships and lottery seasons.
sentences.chinese: 无论胖瘦输赢，冠军杯还是乐透季。

sentences.english: I am a fatalist and I believe in football you win and you lose.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个宿命论者，我相信足球输赢的言论。

sentences.english: Be able to recognize marquee players, win-loss records, and team rivalries.
sentences.chinese: 能够了解选取框式球员，输赢记录和团队对抗。

definition: victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
see 成則為王，敗則為寇|成则为王，败则为寇[cheng2 ze2 wei2 wang2 , bai4 ze2 wei2 kou4]
no arrogance in victory, no despair in defeat
pinyin: sheng4 bu4 jiao1 , bai4 bu4 nei3

definition: to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
to regard as unimportant/to be indifferent to (fame, wealth etc)/(of an economy or a market) to slacken
gains and losses/success and failure/merits and demerits
attitude (of the heart)/state of one's psyche/way of thinking/mentality
stake (in a gamble)/(what is at) stake
(neologism c. 2017) (coll.) chill about everything (typically used to describe young people who don't buy into aspirational society)
to take defeat with bad grace/to be a sore loser/cannot afford to lose
not to become attached to material things, not to pity oneself
pinyin: bu4 yi3 wu4 xi3 , bu4 yi3 ji3 bei1
